snippet: Mitt Romney’s path to the White House would be severely narrowed without the 18 electoral votes from Ohio, where he continues to trail President Obama in polls.
abstract: Mitt Romney campaigns in Ohio fresh off his nominating convention, underlining the importance of the state to his electoral prospects; Pres Obama still holds an advantage in polls in Ohio, and if Romney should lose the state, his path to the White House would be severely narrowed.

byline.original: By JIM RUTENBERG and JEFF ZELENY
byline.contributor: Jim Rutenberg reported from Cincinnati, and Jeff Zeleny from Charlotte, N.C.

lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney’s path to the White House would be severely narrowed without the 18 electoral votes from Ohio, where he continues to trail President Obama in polls.

headline.seo: For Mitt Romney, Ohio Remains a Vital Hurdle
headline.main: In a Tactical Test, Romney Stakes Hopes on Ohio
headline.print_headline: Romney Stakes Hopes on Ohio, A Tactical Test
